original: Killig, Franz Glemens Teodor, disponent, Degerhamn, Öland, f. 22/2/88 i Dresden, Tyskl., av bruksäg. C. T. K. o. Maria Pauiick. G. 37 m. Irma Dietmann. — Stud:ex. i Dresden 07, stud. v. tekn. högsk. i München o. Dresden, univ. i Leipzig o. Greifswald, Dr. phil. 12. Aman. v. mineralog, inst. v. univ. i Greifswald h. prof. L. Milch 11-12, driftsassist., sen. disp. f. Portland Cementfabrik Rüdersdorf Adler 12-19, disp. v. Ölands Cement A-B i Degerhamn sed. 19, verkst. dir. där sed. 39, led. av dess styr. fr. 37. Led. av styr. i Cementa, Sv. Cementförsäljn. A-B 3(9, av Sv. Cementfören. fr. 39. Skr.: Korund- u. Paragonitvorkom-men b. Schv^arzenberg, Sachsen (12), Några anteckn. ur de öl. alunbrukens hist. (26), Degerhamns hamn (historik 31), Die Verwertung- der Ölschiefer in Schweden (26), Ölands kalksten o. gamla stenhantering (33), Ölands Cement A-B 1886-1936 (historik), Lab:-buch f. d. Portlandcem :fabr. (25), Öländska s’lipverk o. skurkvarnar (35) m. fl. upps. o. stud. Hobbies: brukshistorik, arkeol., geol., jakt, saml. av konst, ant. glas, porsl., silver. RVO-2kl, SvRKSM.
translated: Killig, Franz Glemens Teodor, manager, Degerhamn, Öland, b. 22/2/88 in Dresden, Germany, son of factory owner C. T. K. and Maria Pauiick. Married in 1937 to Irma Dietmann. - Completed secondary school in Dresden in 1907, studied at the technical university in Munich and Dresden, and at the universities of Leipzig and Greifswald. Earned a Ph.D. in Philosophy in 1912. Assistant at the mineralogy institute of the University of Greifswald under Professor L. Milch from 1911-1912, later worked as an administrator, and finally as a manager forPortland Cementfabrik Rüdersdorf Adler from 1912-1919. Since 1919, he has been the manager of Ölands Cement A-B in Degerhamn and executive director since 1939, member of the board since 1937. Member of the boards of Cementa, Sv. Cementförsäljn. A-B from 1939, and of Sv. Cementfören. from 1939. Publications: Corundum and Paragonite Deposits in Schwarzenberg, Saxony (1912), Some Notes on the History of Öland's Alum Works (1926), Degerhamn Harbor (Historical Account, 1931), The Utilization of Oil Shale in Sweden (1926), Öland limestone and old stone handling (1933), Ölands Cement AB 1886-1936 (History), Laboratory Book for Portland Cement Factory (1925), Öland's grinding mills and grinding mills (1935), and others. Hobbies: industrial history, archaeology, geology, hunting, collecting art, antique glass, porcelain, silver. Honors: Order of the Polar Star, 2nd Class, Swedish Royal Academy of Sciences Medal.
